conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
There are four streams labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the image.
There are two containers labeled E and F at the bottom of the image.
There are baffles in the image: a yellow slanted baffle, a brown slanted baffle, a grey slanted baffle, and a white horizontal baffle.

premise: Stream A flows downward and is blocked by the yellow slanted baffle.
conclusion: Stream A is deflected to the left.

premise: Stream A flows to the left and is blocked again, eventually draining into container E.
conclusion: Stream A ends in container E.

premise: Stream B flows downward and mixes with the flow from A.
conclusion: Stream B follows the same path as Stream A into container E.

premise: Stream C flows downward and is blocked by the brown slanted baffle.
conclusion: Stream C is deflected to the right.

premise: Stream C flows to the right and follows the path around the baffle into container F.
conclusion: Stream C ends in container F.

premise: Stream D flows downward and is unobstructed by any baffles.
conclusion: Stream D flows straight into container F.

premise: Streams A and B flow into container E, while streams C and D flow into container F.
conclusion: Liquids from A and B will flow into container E, while liquids from C and D will flow into container F.
